name: Version 1.31.0 Release
body:
release-note-bugfix
+ [implement drop_last option for slice](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1113)
+ [fix numpy indice error due to numpy version update](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1109)
+ [add code to allow unlink variable](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1105)

release-note-build
+ [add tensorboard version dependency of file format converter](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1110)
+ [build android target with dynamic link](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1099)

release-note-core
+ [Add narrow function for NdArray](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1096)

release-note-format-converter
+ [Add TopK support to ONNX importer](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1111)
+ [Add GlobalMaxPool, RandomNormal, RandomUniform support to ONNX importer](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1103)
+ [Fix issues in ONNX importer](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1102)
+ [restore the CL-initializer in legacy_nnp_graph.py to graph_def.py](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1100)

release-note-op-layer
+ [Error function (erf) implementation (CPU)](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/pull/1097)

Install the latest nnabla by:
```
pip install nnabla
pip install nnabla-ext-cuda110 # For CUDA version 11.0.3 users
```

You can also install the cuda extension with specific versions from one of the following. [See also FAQ](https://nnabla.readthedocs.io/en/latest/python/install_on_linux.html#faq)
+ nnabla-ext-cuda110 (CUDA 11.0.3 x cuDNN 8.0)
+ nnabla-ext-cuda114 (CUDA 11.4.3 x cuDNN 8.0)
```
pip install nnabla
pip install nnabla_ext_cuda110  # For CUDA 11.0.3 x cuDNN 8.0 users
```

The nnabla cuda extension supports both centralized and distributed training.
Below packages detect MPI and NCCL2 installed on your system. If either one
of then is unavailable, distributed training is disabled.

- nnabla-ext-cuda110  (Ubuntu18.04 default)
- nnabla-ext-cuda114  (Ubuntu18.04 default)


Additional setup may be required depending on your OS or environment. Please check Python Package Installation Guide for details.

[Install Guide](http://nnabla.readthedocs.io/en/latest/python/installation.html)
To use C++ inference feature, follow the demonstration on MNIST inference in C++.

[Demonstration](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/tree/master/examples/cpp/mnist_runtime)

[Build Guide](http://nnabla.readthedocs.io/en/latest/python/build_on_linux_with_dt.html)
The "nnabla-ext-cuda" package is temporarily unavailable. Use of this package is not recommended. Please install nnabla-ext-cuda110, nnabla-ext-cuda114 instead.
The following nnabla CUDA extension packages have been deprecated and the PyPi repository has been (or going to be) closed.

+ nnabla-ubuntu16
+ nnabla-ubuntu18
+ nnabla-ext-cuda
+ nnabla-ext-cuda80
+ nnabla-ext-cuda91
+ nnabla-ext-cuda92
+ nnabla-ext-cuda100
+ nnabla-ext-cuda101
+ nnabla-ext-cuda90-nccl2-ubuntu16
+ nnabla-ext-cuda100-nccl2-ubuntu16
+ nnabla-ext-cuda100-nccl2-ubuntu18
+ nnabla-ext-cuda101-nccl2-ubuntu16
+ nnabla-ext-cuda101-nccl2-ubuntu18
+ nnabla-ext-cuda102-nccl2-mpi2-1-1
+ nnabla-ext-cuda102-nccl2-mpi3-1-6
+ nnabla-ext-cuda110-nccl2-mpi2-1-1
+ nnabla-ext-cuda110-nccl2-mpi3-1-6


The following "nnabla-ext-cuda" docker images have been deprecated.
+ py27-cuda92
+ py36-cuda92
+ py37-cuda92
+ py27-cuda92-v1.0.xx
+ py36-cuda92-v1.0.xx
+ py37-cuda92-v1.0.xx
+ py36-cuda100-v1.xx.x
+ py37-cuda100-v1.xx.x
+ py38-cuda100-v1.xx.x
+ py39-cuda100-v1.xx.x
+ py36-cuda102-v1.xx.x
+ py37-cuda102-v1.xx.x
+ py38-cuda102-v1.xx.x
+ py39-cuda102-v1.xx.x

We've decided to change nnabla's versioning policy to semantic versioning.
This change has been applied from version 1.1.0.

Python 2 is no longer be supported from v1.5.0.
CUDA8.0 is no longer be supported from v1.6.0.
Python3.5 is no longer be supported from v1.14.0.
CUDA9.0 is no longer be supported from v1.14.0.
Python3.6 is no longer be supported from v1.26.0.
CUDA10.0 is no longer be supported from v1.26.0.
CUDA10.2 is no longer be supported from v1.30.0.

name: C++ inference
body:
Link: [Release note of nnabla-ext-cuda v0.9.4](https://github.com/sony/nnabla-ext-cuda/releases/tag/v0.9.4)

### Features

* C++ API for inference is now added. You can execute an inference of a trained model via Neural Network Libraries C++ API. See [mnist_runtime](https://github.com/sony/nnabla/tree/master/examples/cpp/mnist_runtime) for a walk-through example.
* New functions: AbsoluteError, EpsilonInsensitiveLoss

### Changes

* acc2f3d301384b769729190b4ba62fd85001142d Fix docstring typo
* a1f22f6f62f28d51869e0fc486972ea6cfa85d9b C++ inference
* 2649261ef7a26dcdd0b63ddb3cbff3dec0fc8b1a AbsoluteError
* 030de58e993b56e87544512d7dd1526484767e45 EpsilonInsensitiveLoss
* 3654ed599e6c211bf26a602aab3e75a57fbfecae Cifar10 dataset with Python3 support

name: Distributed Training
body:
Link: [Release note of nnabla-ext-cuda v0.9.3](https://github.com/sony/nnabla-ext-cuda/releases/tag/v0.9.3)

### Features

* Multi-device training with CIFAR10/100 example (Currently works with CUDA and NCCL integration. Needs to be built by your self. See the [installation guide for multi-GPU training](https://nnabla.readthedocs.io/en/latest/python/build_on_linux_with_dt.html))
* A Docker image for tutorials is available at DockerHub `nnabla/nnabla:tutorial`. See <https://hub.docker.com/r/nnabla/nnabla/> and <https://hub.docker.com/r/nnabla/nnabla-ext-cuda/>.

### Changes

* 0dcc5cbedebdcab5e8203a0a0f75a5fc4faaaef6 Fix auto formatter
* b43d58042a99ff2d9594a4fc11d2cae29c498cf3 Fix Binary Neural Network function doc
* 57cd06f2be099d770a6d02b47d14e4045a6a7585 Fix top_n_error function doc
* 88934d77773edde6ad5b889c52cf8370bde8a16a
  * Communicator abstract class for parallelization and distributed execution.
  * CIFAR-10/100 examples for multi-thread multi-device training and multi-process multi-device training (working with CUDA extension)
* eda6bc33931613d8304fbd418fc0ff7819f510e5 Rearrange Docker files

name: The first open source version
body:
This version contains;
* Python 2.7 API release
* C++11 core library (no documentation)
* Examples
    * Image classification (MNIST, (Tiny) ImageNet)
    * Image classification with Binary Neural Networks
    * Image embedding with Siamese Networks
    * Image Generation with Deep Convolutional Generative Adversarial Networks (DCGAN) 
    * Word embedding
* Tutorials
* Basic functionalities, function modules, and solver modules necessary for state-of-the-art research and development.
